title: Add a more useful, real-world “Run Scenario” workflow

requirements.text: Add a new, practical test scenario that is clearly related to the app’s keylogger-awareness simulation (e.g., a real-world “public/shared computer login” style scenario) and make it available from the existing “Test Scenarios” panel with working “Run Scenario”, learning content, and quiz support.

quotes: add run scenario with something usefula nd related to it

acceptanceCriteria: A new scenario appears in the existing Test Scenarios list (frontend/src/components/TestScenariosPanel.tsx) with a name, short description, and expected outcome.

Clicking “Run Scenario” on the new scenario triggers the existing runScenario flow (frontend/src/hooks/useSimulationState.ts) and visibly plays back the scenario text into the simulation input (no manual typing required).
The scenario has associated learning content returned by getScenarioContent (frontend/src/lib/scenarioLearningContent.ts) and it renders correctly in the collapsible learning-content section.
The scenario has an associated quiz entry (frontend/src/lib/scenarioQuizzes.ts) and clicking “Take Test” opens the quiz modal for that scenario without errors.

requirements.text: Update the scenario runner’s preset text for the newly added scenario to be educational, defensive, and privacy-safe (no real credentials; avoid providing instructions that enable wrongdoing), while still being realistic enough to demonstrate risk scoring/auto-blocking behavior.

quotes: add run scenario with something usefula nd related to it

acceptanceCriteria: The new scenario’s preset text is included in the runScenario mapping in frontend/src/hooks/useSimulationState.ts.
The preset text does not include real-looking secrets (e.g., actual credit card/SSN formats) and stays in a defensive/awareness tone.
Running the scenario produces a non-trivial outcome in the simulation (e.g., Medium/High risk or auto-block if enabled), consistent with the scenario’s “Expected” label shown in the UI.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only components must only be composed).
Do not edit immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
Backend must remain single-actor; do not add additional canisters/services.
nonGoals: Do not add real-time networking, data exfiltration, or any functionality that captures/transmits real user keystrokes.
Do not implement third-party auth providers; keep authentication limited to Internet Identity (if used at all).
Do not introduce a database or any external persistence service.
